DOC.brief_summary: The purpose trial ass effect combine regular , generous intake high quality protein ( primarily lean pork animal source protein ) calorie restriction functional status lean muscle mass frail , obese , woman participate 6 month intervention 9 month intervention .
DOC.brief_title: A High Protein Weight Loss Intervention Sarcopenic Obesity Women
DOC.detailed_description: Assess effect combine regular , generous intake high quality protein ( primarily lean pork animal source protein ) calorie restriction functional status lean muscle mass frail , obese , woman participate 6 month intervention 9 month intervention . For 6 month intervention : Participants randomize one two study arm : Weight Loss Control ( n = 20 ) subject follow calorie-reduced diet weight loss ≥10 % ; Weight Loss-High Protein : ( n = 40 ) subject follow calorie-reduction diet weight loss ≥10 % , high proportion high quality protein meal . Intakes > 30g high quality protein achieve three time day subject group , predominantly animal source 60-70 % animal protein pork . Subject criterion include obese ( > 30 kg/m2 ) woman ( ≥ 45 yr . ) mild moderate functional impairment ( 6 minute walk ) . For 9 month intervention : Participants randomize one two study arm : Weight Loss Control ( n = 10 ) subject follow calorie-reduced diet weight loss ≥10 % ; Weight Loss-High Protein : ( n = 10 ) subject follow calorie-reduction diet weight loss ≥10 % , high proportion high quality protein meal . Intakes > 30g high quality protein achieve three time day subject group , predominantly animal source 60-70 % animal protein pork . Subject criterion include obese ( ≥ 30 kg/m2 ) woman ( ≥ 60 yr . ) mild moderate functional impairment ( 6 minute walk ) . This randomized clinical trial repeat measurement , purpose assess change time overall sample difference High Protein group relative Control group regard primary outcome ( function lean body mass ) . The statistical analysis proceed chronologically 3 phase : 1 ) descriptive analysis summarize distribution covariates dependent variable , 2 ) bivariate analysis association group membership outcome measure , 3 ) control multivariable analysis , assess association experimental group outcome , control important covariates .
DOC.criteria: Age 45+ yr . BMI > 30 kg/m2 Body weight < 495 lb . Normal blood chemistry Normal renal function Primary care physician acknowledgement NonVegetarian Mild moderate movement impairment Body weight > 495 pound . Current smoker . Presence unstable , acutely symptomatic , lifelimiting illness . Positive screen dementia use MiniCog evaluation tool . Neurological condition cause functional cognitive impairment . History significant weight instability ( define > 10 pound weight gain loss 6 month prior study participation ) . Unwillingness inability randomize one two intervention group , submit study test continuously participate randomly assign lifestyle intervention program six month . Inability walk independently . Bilateral hip replacement . Unable give consent . Unable complete write record form include journal eat exercise behavior . Current use follow medication : monoamine oxidase inhibitor , prescription weight loss medication . Primary Care Physician advise participation .
